column2: 35-44 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I have been taking a generic version of Klonopin for 5 years now. At first I took it every day at 1mg doses for the first 6 months. Now only take it when I need it at 0.5mg's. It works great for general anxiety. If you have something such as a major fear of public speaking its not going to kill that anxiety 100 % by itself. Consider taking it with Propranolol. That combination is a miracle worker. But as far as just general anxiety goes Klonopin by itself is great. I've never really had any major withdraw side effects with it but then I'm at a small dose anyways. When I'm taking it I feel really at ease with my thoughts and others around. If you take this please don't be a jerk while taking it. Enjoy the fact your finally not anxious for once and at peace. Some people use it as an excuse to act stupid or annoying. Sure your going to feel nice while your taking it but don't be 'that guy' and give people a bad reputation that need to take it to function normally. You are still in control and your not drunk so be responsible.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $2$1$4$Klonopin is the least benzodiazepine of the benzodiazpines. Please understand that now. Chemically speaking it's just barely a benzo. When I was first prescribed this it was a direct switch from Xanax. Well...that didn't go over too well! Went into extreme Xanax withdrawals
column3: I was sweating so hard (and shaking) that it frightened me - Klonopin was a poor direct replacement for Xanax. I came to learn that Klonopin simply doesn't share all the characteristics of other benzodiazepines. People need to know this upfront
column4: lest they find it out the hard way. The only plus
column5: perhaps
column6: is that Klonopin doesn't have a strongly sedating component. So it might be useful for those wanting to maintain 100% alertness during the day. That's about it. Common side effects characteristic of Klonopin: very glassy eyes and a distinct change in behavior. Me
column7: I became too 'outspoken' while on it. And not in a good way.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$1$1$"For those people that seem to have an attitude about why Klonopin has worked for them
column3: why they take it
column4: etc.
column5: I say good for you and your attitude
column6: and lack of knowledge and/or withdrawal experience.  The worst is yet to come.

column2: was amazed at how awesome I was and felt when I started taking it.  There's no question Klonopin works very well. It just works too well...until the dosage isn't enough. It's not that it stops working on your brain
column3: it just becomes confusing to the patient because old symptoms start to re-appear. It's still breaking through the blood brain barrier and shutting down/taking over your Gaba receptors though. The problem is
column4: the brain has now begun to rely on the drug instead of its own calming mechanism
column5: so it needs more. Most Drs just up the dose
column6: which only makes the brain more dependent
column7: shutting down more receptors.

column1: Klonopin was never intended as a drug to be taken long term
column2: for very good reason.

column1: I ended up in the emergency room 4 different times b/c I was in tolerance withdrawal. I didn't know I was
column2: until the 4th ER visit to a different hospital. The dr was smart enough to know
column3: to tell me and to contact my dr. That was over a year ago and I've been tapering since then. It's been a roller coaster but nothing compared to now
column4: as I'm at .25mg pills that I'm slowly cutting down each week.

column1: There's no way to explain the withdrawals. Ive always kept my body as healthy and strong as possible
column2: but this little pill is a ticket to hell. Ive suffered so many grand mal seizures but I'd rather deal with the seizures
column3: than go thru this hell again.

column1: I have zero respect for anyone associated with delving this poison out.  Honestly
column2: you are all satan's little helpers.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I am a 47 year old Male and have been on antidepressants for over 25 years. I have tried many different drugs.  I suffered horribly with thoughts of suicide on a daily bases I hated those feelings!! I didn't want my family to think that I was a quitter so I pushed through those thoughts everyday! Klonopin was suggested by a friend who had a bottle of pills they had stopped taking. I took .5 mg a day for the first week and my thoughts of suicide faded away I went to my doctor who had me on Wellbutrin 3 pills a day he told me to keep taking the klonopin at .5mg a day along with the Wellbutrin. I have taken the same dose for a year and a half and still feel great no thoughts of suicide. Side effects
column3: makes me sleepy but if I get out of bed and stay active that feeling diminishes.  I personally would have to say that klonopin has saved my life. 8/14

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$4$4$I am writing this post to warn all who are interested in taking any benzodiazepan - they can be extremely helpful but are incredibly physically addictive and often times your GP or prescribing physician does not inform you of that.  I was taking Klonopin once a day at 1 MG for about 4 months and then I leaned how addictive it was and stopped cold turkey.  My mistake - I narrowly avoided having a seizure and didn't sleep for almost a week or eat or anything due to the withdrawal.  I went back to taking them and had a psychiatist wean me off of them
column3: and I still experienced withdrawal symptons though not as bad.  So
column4: please be careful
column5: only take it when you need it
column6: and consult with a physician when you choose to stop taking it.  I am currently taking it again - though only as needed
column7: and no more than 3 times a week - because life stressors have been more than I can handle lately.  So
column8: just please be careful with this drug
column9: it can be so helpful but in the long run the cure may be worse than the cause.

I have no trouble recommending this drug.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I had been diagnosed with acute anxiety disorder in my early 20's (I'm now almost 40). In my opinion I would rate Klonopin at the top of all benzodiazepines (and i've tried almost all of them) as it has a relatively long half-life (lasts longer than most benzos). I have been taking .25mg (1/2 of a .5mg tablet) daily for nearly a decade now
column3: and I have had no urge or need to increase my dosage (although it does take discipline to take the absolutely smallest effective amount without wanting to experiment with more).  This dosage
column4: combined with regular cardio excercise
column5: has eliminated what was once extreme debilitating panic/anxiety.  If you're going to start this medication
column6: take small amounts (experiment with the smallest dosage possible that still remedies your anxiety
column7: etc).  Don't ever get into the habit of taking more
column8: and stay indifferent to people
column9: doctors
column10: the media
column11: etc
column12: who criticize the use of this medication. Become comfortable with the likelihood that you may need to take this medication permanently. In other words
column13: if you maintain a small daily dose regimin
column14: there's no need to put yourself through the pain of ceasing the use of this wonderful medication. I am certain it is much more harmful to stop taking this medication than it would be to continue to use it responsibly for a life-time.

102$Condition: A Feeling of Restlessness with Inability to Sit Still$9/18/2013 4:28:19 PM$Reviewer: Bridget, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$For years I refused most meds but was given klonipin along with an ssri 3 years ago...should have tried earlier....works like a charm for me.  Took it as prescribed and felt for once in my life balanced and even tempered...helped with so many of my other conditions as well, gi problems, etc.  Only went off once suddenly because I had a back injury and didn't want to take pain meds with klonipin...never do that again!!! Much healthier for me to NOT take pain meds but stay on klonipin...during most of the year I have lessened the dosage to 1 1/2 tabs per day ....taken 1/2 3pm, and 1 at bedtime.  I cannot take other meds like elavil or nortriptolene ...those make me jump out of my skin and turn me severely depressed.  Have never felt like jumping off a high deck but elavil and nortriptolene did!!! It's all blood chemistry and you must work closely with your health care provider at all times.  Klonipin works wonders for me.  Also be careful though with mixing it with any other drugs...look at the ingredients and any contraindications,

106$Condition: Panic Disorder$8/18/2013 3:30:11 PM$Reviewer: Coopers, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$I know they say mood drugs affect people differently,  but the effects of this drug were very frightening to me. I took it for 3 weeks at 1mg per day and I felt like I lost 3 weeks of my life... as in I remembered it happening, but didn't feel like I was even there. I quit my job, I got pulled over for driving erratically and I cried every night. I felt like there was no way out, and my husband asked me to stop the medication and call my doctor immediately. I hadn't talked to most of my friends, but the one I did told me something hadn't been right but she didn't know what. I've never lost hope like that before. I talked to the magistrate about the ticket I received,  got a note fromy doctor... but it turns out the magistrate didn't even need it. He said he was very familiar with the drug and implied that he wished it weren't even on the market. The only other stories I have heard directly from people are similar if not so severe. The drug even earned a comment on 'Silver Linings Playbook.' I am terrified of this drug, and what it could do to other people out there. Maybe it works for some, but as with any mood drug please me extra careful. I am now on Depakote for mood instead and my anxiety has subsided. Also consider a good therapist before messing around with this stuff.

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$5$5$"Prescribed for my chronic anxiety to use as needed.  Feel a light buzz at 1mg shortly after taking it but nothing else.  At 2mg my anxiety begins to get reduced and mood is slightly boosted and every milligram above that reduces my anxiety accordingly but doesn't make me any more euphoric than the 2mg dose.  Mood and anxiety are affected 30 minutes after dosing. Drowsiness kicks in a few hours after dosing.  Memory and cognitive impairment can begin on as low as a 3mg dosage for me since I have little benzodiazepine tolerance built up.  Doses above 3mg
column3: watch out.  Blackoutland and confusion while blacking out (I recorded myself).  Too bad
column4: because my anxiety was actually manageable for those 12 or 24 hours after dosing.  I settle for 2mg doses.  This way I avoid most of the drowsiness and avoid cognitive and memory impairment while getting to feel a slight mood boost and some anxiety relief.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$3$1$Benzo's are heaven/hell drugs. They are extremely effective in controlling anxiety and panic disorders. They are also extremely addictive. Doctor's like Klonopin because it has a long half-life. Apparently
column3: some people do have a body chemistry that keeps them from getting addicted
column4: or it could be how they take the medication. I have been on Benzo's 19 years. I have CFS. I tried an adrenal supplement for it and it caused the panic disorder. So at age 34 I was put on Benzo's. I'm almost 54 now. The addiction started around the one-year mark. It nearly killed me. Now I wear 2 watches so I can take my morning and evening dose to the second. My body is synchronized to a 3rd watch that I don't set the alarm on so I won't run down the battery. That is the one I take my pills by. Also
column5: because each pill is a different weight I bought a precision scale and I file each pill down to the same weight. But each batch of the drug has a different amount of medicine in it so some months I'd start feeling sick and I had to increase my dose ever so slightly using the scale. AND
column6: pharmacies like to change the brand you're on so that has been a battle. I had a close friend who committed suicide because of her Klonopin addiction. She was an OB/GYN nurse
column7: with CFS. That was about 15 years ago. Now
column8: I'm taking care of my elderly mother who lives with me and still managing my addiction (with the help of a wonderful and very understanding psychiatrist). Oh
column9: my dose is 1mg twice a day. I hope this will help someone. Good luck and be careful.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$highly effective. ONLY for occasional or short term use!  All benzos are highly addictive and effects will wear off requiring higher and higher dosages to maintain desired effects.  Anziety snd/or panic attacks will disapper immediately if you have never used benzos before.  Alcoholics or recovering acohol/drug addicts should only used under physician monitored dosage.  Exceedeing prescribed dosage will result in extreme sleepiness and further the development of addicton.  Withdrawal symptoms mild compared to aocohol or opiates
column3: but if you stop abruptly you will feel highly agitated and will not be able to sleep for several days.  Very useful when needed but long term everyday use may cause more problems than origianl issue drug prescribed for.  Mixing with alcohol or other tranquilizers will cause euphoria followed by deep sleep and can be lethal.

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$4$4$I have been on Klonopin for 25 years.  It usually reduces my tics.  They do increase with stress and Klonopin causes sexual problems including ED.  However other ED medications
column3: both RX and especially certain herbal found on 'Better Sex Mall' conteract the sexual side affects.  I change dosage between 1 to 2 mg per day and occasionally discontinue for short times without any withdrawal or rebound.  For me all of the side effects expounded have not been a problem.  I have had Tourette syndrome since age 9 or 10 and I'm now 71.  This has been a miracle drug for me and should be given a good try under a physician's care before dismissing it because of all the warnings and expressed side effects.  I am not addicted to it even after 25 years of use.

55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $2$1$5$I was prescribed Klonopin for anxiety.  Within a month
column3: it stopped working.  I built a tolerance to the drug.  What I DID not know was that the drug is HIGHLY physically addictive.  I spoke to a Neurologist who told me that is as addictive as heroin or alcohol.  She told me that it is VERY dangerous to withdraw from Klonopin suddenly. She gave me a slow taper schedule
column4: but it was VERY difficult.  I experienced tremors
column5: nausea
column6: and sweats during the withdrawal period.  After the last does
column7: it took 35 hours to completely leave my system...and the anxiety came back with a vengeance.  This drug should only be used for a very short time.  In my opinion
column8: Klonopin should have a black box warning on the label.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$3$3$"When I was a little girl
column3: my mother has ""agoriphobia"" and
column4: for a time
column5: she would never leave the house. I swore I would never be like that. I thought she should just get over it and I was a little embarrassed by her ""illness."" But one day I was driving with my two children in the car
column6: and out of the blue I had this sense of impending doom
column7: my heart was slamming in my chest
column8: and I was terrified that I would die behind the wheel and my children would die in a subsequent car crash.  I went to see a doctor who
column9: luckily
column10: had some training in the signs of hormonal imbalance and a LOT more compassion than I showed my mom.  I was diagnosed as being peri-menopausal. Klonopin was the first stop-gap for me - it saved me from becoming a prisoner in my home
column11: as my mom had been.  It also helped me help HER discover that this was a medical disorder
column12: not a mental one.(I still feel guilty for how I treated her.)  That helped HER find help as well. I was off Klonipin for years
column13: and started taking it again after breast cancer. Unfortunately I am now on a drug that robs me of estrogen for life)and low estrogen was my problem in the beginning. Having to deal with hot flashes and panic again
column14: my doc put me on up to .5 mg per day (half pill as needed). I don't take it every day - the problem seems to follow a monthly calendar. But when I do take it
column15: I'm able to get on with life: no drowsiness
column16: no drugged-up feeling. The doc did try anti-depressants which actually increased my symptoms - which
column18: didn't surprise him. This medication is my rescue
column19: not my daily regime. I resisted taking it even as often as I currently do
column20: but he said I am not refilling my script half as often as I am allowed
column21: so he said I need to think of this in terms of being a rescue companion to the drug that keeps me from having breast cancer again. "

column1: 335$Condition: Panic Disorder$12/2/2010 1:35:22 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been stuggling with postpartum depression/anxiety afer my son was born 6 months ago. My anxiety was so bad that i had a breakdown and had to be admited inpatient to a stress center. After a month of being on Xanax as needed and paxil I felt like I was getting worse. I was waking up with severe anxiety and that would turn into a tailspin of crying and extreme panic! Not fun. I finally found a medical professional who knows what she is doing. She is a physiciatric NP. She put me on Klonopin .5mg am/bedtime and she is weaing me off Paxil to the Zoloft. Let's just say I went from histeria on Tuesday morning to calmness upon waking this morning. I am sleeping well also. I expect to be on Klonopin until I am well on Zoloft and then taper off. If you take yourself off of Klonopin by yourself cold turkey of course your going to feeling it. Make sure you are with a physciatrist who knows meds and there side effects and how they will react with you personally. Good luck with everyone else out there

25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$I have been on this drug for 4 months. I was put on it after having been given a steroid drug post partum to treat a rash. The steroid combined with my post partum state sent my adrenaline out of control and cause anxiety and insomnia. I am seeing one of the top psychiatrists in my city on the subject of anxiety/post partum. This drug has worked well and worked immediately. I mainly wanted to post this because it seems that there is some confusion on here about how to wean. My instructions were to wean myself (as long as I am not having any problems with sleep or anxiety) by a quarter of a tablet (.5mg tablet) not more frequently than every 3 weeks. That is a very SLOW taper. If anyone is on this
column3: make sure you listen to your medical provider on the taper and I doubt you will experience these withdrawal symptoms that some have written. I was taking 3 tablets (1.5 mg) 4 months ago and am now down to 2.25 tablets. That is only dosing myself down by 3 quarters of a tablet in 4 months. This is how to be safe about it. Just be patient and try not to freak out that you are taking this medication. It is just for a season of life and it will end. Be patient.

569$Condition: Panic Disorder$8/24/2009 10:54:44 AM$Reviewer: imaginethat, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$4$Definitely an effective med for anxiety.  It really helps me focus.  Also significantly reduces my frequent onslaught of overwhelming brain activity that keeps me distracted and unable to focus.  I recently started back on Klonopin after being off for several years.  The only downside is the addictive aspect of this drug.  It is extremely important that you wean yourself off very slowly.  The manufacturer recommends reducing your dose .125 every 3 days.  I would follow that advice if at all possible.  When I was on it before, I just stopped taking it, and was almost hospitilized...having some of the worst out-of-body feelings and physical ailments I've ever felt.  Be careful when stopping use!!!

column1: 592$Condition: Panic Disorder$7/14/2009 7:32:52 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$1$4$"While I agree that Klonopin is very effective
column2: like any benzo-diazapan they also come with severe risks. It is so addictive it is the only drug besides alcohol that can actually kill you if you stop taking it without a doctor supervising.

column1: This can mean that some people who have never abused drugs can end up in a detox center if they have been on a high dose for a lot of years. I do not understand why the drug companies have not found something as effective without the deadly side effects.  It's pretty sad that heroin
column2: cocaine
column3: meth
column4: all illegal drugs do not have the risk of killing you while detoxing but something legal and prescribed does. I do believe there are many people who really need these types of medications but I also believe they are overperscribed as an easy fix to panic attacks. They should be a last resort only and doctors should tell the patients how highly addictive and deadly they can be.  I have honestly seen it ruin lives
column5: and I will honestly admit for all my anger against benzo-diazapans I am still afraid of being off it.I would recommend people to try DBT therapy
column6: it has helped me and I plan on continuing it to help me cope
column7: your phychotherapist/counsler should be able to do this for you. In DBT
column8: patients are not told that their feelings are wrong
column9: but rather that they need to find a more positive way to manage them
column10: They learn mindfulness
column11: stepping back and being conscious of the moment without judging it as good or bad
column12: and other emotion regulating skills
column13: so that their feelings have less influence on their behavior.

column2: coping with situations as they are -- and methods of self-soothing and distraction. It has worked wonders for me!"

35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have taken Clonazepam (Klonopin) for over 4 years.  I initially was started on 0.5mg 2x a day every day for a year and then started taking Lexapro with it.  I continued to take the Clonazepam for another year with the lexapro then decided to wean myself of the clonazepam and just take in on an as needed basis.  It works wonderful for a ""PRN"" (as needed) drug.  I probably take it once or twice every two months and during those times I will take it for 3 or 4 days and then stop and go about my routine till I feel the need for it again.  My anxiety has been greatly under control
column3: it's just every once in a while it creeps up on you and you feel like you can't function.  It's these instances when clonazepam works wonders.  I hope this helps all those with anxiety issues.  I would not recommend this drug on a ""full-time"" basis.  I think it is a great drug to be used in conjunction with another SSRI or SNRI until one that is found that works.  Once the SSRI or SNRI is found to work
column4: the person should wean themselves off this med and then just use it as an as needed medication."

column1: 760$Condition: Panic Disorder$10/28/2008 2:17:07 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$My doc RXed this drug to me 2 years ago after dealing with several personal issues. I have always dealt with chronic panic attacks (15 years or so). I have been prescribed every antidepressant imaginable and nothing worked because I am not depressed. I have extremely high anxiety and panic disorder. Klonopin has helped me so much. I used to not even be able to function at work or even in public due to panic attacks and I am fine now. I have had only a couple of mild attacks in 2 yrs. I recently went to my doc for a follow up and I told her I wanted to decrease my dosage to .25 from .50 and I tried .25 for 2 weeks and couldn't handle the decrease so I went back to .50. I am a troubled sleeper due to high anxiety and I went 2 weeks on little to no sleep. Klonpin is great for insomnia. Doc says if I am ok at .50 I should stay there. I don't want to become physically dependant on this drug to function
column2: but it has helped so much with panic and anxiety. I have no side effects and have never had to increase my dose in 2 yrs. I have always taken .50 1X per day. I'm going to try to decrease to .25mg again and see if I can get past the effects. Overall
column3: I highly recommend this drug over vallium and xanex. I can function fine after taking it and feel great after a full night's sleep.

787$Condition: Other$9/12/2008 3:14:19 AM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$1$4$Given klonopin for chronic headaches, including migraines.  Helpful for a while, but, in time, found anxiety was increasing.  (Have read up on this medication and found this is common.)  The difficult part was STOPPING the medication.  In a word - HORRIFIC!!! I tapered off with my doctor's schedule, very carefully. I NEVER abused the medication, took .5 mg 3xday as prescribed - but when I stopped it, I went through the most horrific withdrawal ever.  21 days of constant, debilitating anxiety - and I had NEVER had a panic attack before!  In my opinion, you can become addicted to this drug WITHOUT abusing it --the physical and emotional withdrawal was evidence of it.  I see this drug as POISON now - I would NEVER take it again.

893$Condition: Panic Disorder$1/31/2008 1:18:31 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking Klonopin for two years.  I started at .25 three times a day, then after a year, went down to .25 twice a day, and now I take .25 once a day.  Thank god for this drug!  I started having anxiety attacks two years ago, and have only had one in two years (and it was a situation that would cause anyone to feel anxious, so I wasn't too worried - did some Yoga and felt much better).  It worked from the first day I took it.  It works quickly, and for a longer period of time than Xanax and Ativan.  I'm taking Effexor XR as well for anxiety, and it's been a winning combination.  I'm weaning off the klonopin because it makes me sleepy, and the Effexor is working well, but I am really glad this drug was available when I started treatment.  I was really depressed when the attacks started, thinking I'd always be limited because of the fear of having an attack and this worked so well, within a week, I was back to my old self.  I will still take it on an as-needed basis for the occasional bout of anxiety.

902$Condition: Panic Disorder$1/6/2008 6:17:41 PM$Reviewer: Catherine, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$4$GPD.  Took med for 9-10 years - At the beginning Dr. prescribed 2mg a day...too much, always sleepy. .5mg, once a day worked for me for the time I took it.  The long term affect of the daily dose kept me at an even keel unlike Xanax.  Weaned myself off, with Dr.s knowledge.  Decreased a 1/2 dose every two weeks until I stopped.  Side Effects:  I was sometimes clumsy, fell a couple of times...shattered my kneecap, tripped up stairs and down.  Then I read it adds to Osteo. Am now exercising, eating healthy.  Doing my best to control any panic attacks that I feel may be coming on.  Of course, therapy during that time helped me...deep breathing, subtracting 3 from 100, walking, drinking water (this is during a panic attack.  I have only had the beginning of a couple panic attacks since.  Have been off for two years, now.  But you should have a therapist you can trust, who deals with panic disorder.  Meds can help, but I found that learning to live with a disorder you can try to control through therapy has saved my life.  I'm not saying I will never use Klonopin again, because if I need to I will go back on it.  I loved the calm feeling it gave me.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$2$5$"Used for anxiety
column3: also took wellbutrin for depression.  I have not been on any medication in more a year and am glad to say I have not have any unpleasant side effects. Klonopin did work wonders for anxiety
column4: BUT and this is a huge BUT. Was extremely addicted to this after being on it for a year. Was ""fired"" by my therapist and I went online to learn how to ween myself off of it. I recommend it for anxiety because it works but it's very addictive and made me very tired to the point I would just dose off to sleep. Felt like a junkie. NEVER stop this medication abrubtly.  And if I missed a dose would get the shakes. I emphasize that it does work extremely well but you will become ADDICTED to this medication so be mindful of this. I weened myself off of it SLOWLY and didn't experience any withdrawal symptoms.  I have changed my diet and only eat ORGANIC and whenever I get a little stressed I go the health food store.  They sell homepathic medicine that works just as well for my anxiety and sleepiness without the negative side effects. The organic diet help cut out the intense food cravings I was having. BUT never ever stop taking your medication unless you consult with your physican first.  I don't knock tradional medicine because it helped get me through my rough time when I got divorced and lost my home and everything else I valued and felt like I wanted to end it. I still have ""talk"" therapy and I would still use traditional medication if I need to but I felt I was on klonopin too long and shouldn't have been on it that long. And if it ever gets to point again I would defintely use if it I had to again.  God bless everyone one of you.  Having a mental illness is not easy but just know that it will get better and eventually the sun will come out again. If one medication doesn't help don't give keep trying until you find something that works for you.  Not all medications work the same for everyone but eventually you find something that works for you.  "

column3: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"I was on Xanax from 15 to 30. I was switched to Klonopin and for me it works perfectly. I have had very few panic attacks. I do not get high from it like the Xanax. It is just an even feeling that both helps my panic disoorder and helps with the manic side of Bipolar. I personally have not had depression increase of suicidal thoughts but have known people who have so talk to your doctor. Everypne is different and this is addictive so never just stop taking it. I had to once as a psychiatrist ""fired"" me and did not wean me down and I was amess for three months and could have died I was later told. I take 6mg per day. 3 doses of 2 mg. Most people need way less than that so talk to your doctor. For me though
column4: I am happy with this mediaction and probably will stay on it for life. Again
column5: I like that it never makes me feel high. Some people it may. That is not good. "
